abilitiesRevealed.description: Kizaru creates a sword made entirely of light, which he uses to clash with Rayleigh's sword.
Kizaru uses reflected light to move at incredible speeds, attempting to bypass Rayleigh and chase the Straw Hats.
As a Logia-type fruit, attacks from Usopp and Brook pass harmlessly through Kizaru's light body.

keyMoments.description: Usopp and Brook's attacks pass through Kizaru's light body, demonstrating his Logia invulnerability.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the overwhelming advantage of Logia-type Devil Fruits against opponents who cannot use Haki.

keyMoments.description: Kizaru creates the Ama no Murakumo light sword and clashes with Rayleigh, showing advanced Devil Fruit techniques.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Kizaru's mastery of his Devil Fruit, capable of creating solid constructs from light for combat.

abilitiesRevealed.description: Kuma uses his paw-padded hands to repel people, sending them flying to distant locations. The victim vanishes in a bubble-like effect and is transported across vast distances.

keyMoments.description: Kuma uses his power to make Zoro completely disappear, teleporting him to an unknown location.
keyMoments.significance: This marks the beginning of the Straw Hats' forced separation. The true nature of Kuma's power is revealed - he can send people to specific locations, not kill them.

abilitiesRevealed.description: By consuming multiple Rumble Balls, Chopper transforms into a massive, uncontrollable monster form with incredible destructive power but no rational thought.

keyMoments.description: Chopper transforms into Monster Point out of desperation to protect his crew from the Pacifista.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the crew's absolute desperation. Chopper only uses this dangerous form as a last resort.
